pr_title: Added the Platform Config to JibContainerBuilder and ContainerConfiguration

timeline.message: Adding the platforms config to the JibContainerBuilder
Update Javadocs and CHANGELOG for platforms (#2591)
Adding the platforms config to the container builders
Adding the platforms config to the container builders

timeline.bodyText: Maybe Sets the desired platforms, a list of {@link Platform} ?
timeline.author: loosebazooka

timeline.bodyText: Is it true here as well, that we amd64/linux set by default?
timeline.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: Yes amd64/linux is already in the platforms list by default when we use addPlatforms
replies.author: louismurerwa

timeline.bodyText: Switch the argument order in all these lines. Don't forget to switch the order in Javdoc as well.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText:
Let's copy the Javadoc from ContainerBuildPlan. Suggested change * Adds a platform to the platforms configurations for the container. * Adds a desired image platform (OS and architecture pair). If the base image reference is a * Docker manifest list or an OCI image index, an image builder may select the base image * matching the given platform. If the base image reference is an image manifest, an image * builder may ignore the given platform and use the platform of the base image or may decide to * raise on error. * *

Note that a new build plan starts with "amd64/linux" as the default platform. If you want * to reset the default platform instead of adding a new one, use {@link #setPlatforms(Set)}.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: Let's copy the Javadoc from ContainerBuildPlan.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: The Javadoc is outdated. Let's copy the once from ContainerBuildPlan.
timeline.author: chanseokoh
chanseokoh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -52,6 +59,45 @@
     @Nullable private String user;
     @Nullable private AbsoluteUnixPath workingDirectory;
 
+    /**
+     * Sets a desired platform list ,a list containing (OS and architecture pairs). If the base
+     * image reference is a Docker manifest list or an OCI image index, must be set so that an image
+     * builder can select the images matching the given platforms. If the base image reference is an
+     * image manifest, this value is ignored and the platform of the built image follows that of the
+     * base image. The default is {@code linux amd64 }.
+     *
+     * @param platforms is a list of platform objects to be used to select base images in case of a
+     *     manifest list
+     * @return this
+     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if a user passes in an empty platform list

timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: This commit happened before we changed the arch/os order thats why it was so behind.
replies.author: louismurerwa

replies.bodyText: I don't think so. I (as well as GitHub) are looking at the latest branch, and the order I see is os and then architecture.
replies.author: chanseokoh
